questions.text: What is the name of the restaurant that Lucille gets into a fight at?
questions.explanation:
Klimpy's.

	Michael decides to take George Michael to an interview at a very prestigious school in order to make him successful.  At the interview, the owner tells Michael that he is trying to prevent the Bluth name from entering his school because things keep getting worse for the family.  Lucille's recent fight at Klimpy's family restaurant is brought up soon after.

questions.text: Who attempts to fight Lucille at the restaurant?
questions.explanation:
Lindsay.

	After being forced to go to Klimpy's when a different restaurant was overseated, Lindsay and Lucille argued about many problems.  At the end of the dinner, Lucille and Lindsay were both obviously drunk, and they were still loudly arguing.  Before Lindsay could throw some cake at Lucille, the cops came in.

questions.text: According to Lucille, which sibling was the only one who actually liked taking classes at the Milford school?
questions.explanation:
Buster.

	The school's motto "Children should neither be seen nor heard" applied to Buster in many ways.  Buster spent two years after graduation still studying at the school.  Obviously, you can tell that the motto still applies, because every few episodes, Buster can be seen hiding in Lucille's apartment slinking around everywhere.

The gym.

	After flirting with Jessica, Michael eventually gets her number, and she tries to help him with public relations for the Bluth Company.  The Family meets at the model home to talk to the new publicist.

questions.text: What does Lindsay get a job selling?
questions.explanation:
Vodka.

	After Jessica suggests that Gob do magic shows for charity, Lindsay jumps in and says that she's the charitable one in the family.  Jessica says that Lindsay should get a job so that she's better seen by the public, so she gets hooked up with selling vodka at high-class bars and clubs.

questions.text: Where does Tobias need to go to get his medical license renewed?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	Jessica tells Tobias to stop dreaming about becoming an actor because it'll never happen, so she hooks him up with an interview across the country, and Michael pays for his shuttle and plane tickets.  Tobias says that he's just waiting to land a big job and he just needs a 'sign' from the heavens.  Meanwhile, Jessica tells Buster to be neither seen nor heard because he makes people feel uneasy.

questions.text: Where does Tobias meet Carl Weathers?
questions.explanation:
On the airport shuttle.

	Tobias ends up driving through parts of Los Angeles that he's never seen before (sometimes coming across snow) until finally the shuttle picks up Carl Weathers.  Carl Weathers plays as himself in a few more episodes of "Arrested Development" in the first and second seasons.

questions.text: Where does Gob begin his tour of charity magic shows?
questions.explanation:
A nursing home.

	After being forced to hold charity magic shows, Gob is angry that he has to perform in front of such old people.  When he performs his trick called 'The Aztec Tomb', he ends up losing one of the seniors during the disappearing act, and he's found a while later.  He ends up telling Gob that he's trying to escape the seniors center.

questions.text: Jessica quits her job with the Bluth Company.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Michael gets worried that George Michael doesn't want him dating anyone because he still misses his mother, but really, George Michael is nervous because he doesn't want to go to the Milford School.  Michael tells Jessica that he doesn't want to date her and she decides to quit.  A short while after, Gob calls Michael with the news that someone never reappeared during his 'Aztec Tomb' trick.

questions.text: What is the name of the old man that disappears during Gob's trick?
questions.explanation:
Earl.

	Gob ends up finding Earl in a trunk as he was packing up his magic show.  Earl tells Gob that they get abused at the nursing home, so he escaped.  Gob tries to become a hero, but when he opens the box for the press, Earl is dead.  Jessica prints a horrible story about the family in the paper, and once again, the family is responsible for another brawl in a restaurant.
